story: Mahmoud Tantawy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Cache is the new RAM
caption: carlos.bueno.org
description: One of the (few) advantages of being in technology for a long time is that you get to see multiple tech cycles beginning to end. You get to see how breakthroughs actually propagate. If all you have seen is a part of the curve, itâ€™s hard to extrapolate correctly. You either overshoot the short-term pâ€¦

data.message: Added complexity is the main cost.. For a primary CPU cache system it's mandatory to include subsystems of routing tags to memory locations with virtual address translation.. So is for networking systems..
Ahmed M. AbouZaid that's so 2013 :D.. for 2015: microservices and serverless infrastructure :D

I've actually had a mini-discussion about this article with some colleagues before. My main point here was how sad it is that *most* local web startups never seen growth past the stage of the 2000's/2002's. 

Even ones who actually employ newer solutions like nosql or custom memcaching, only do so because it's trendy and it's how the cool guys out there do it. Not because they've actually went through the growth pains or had the load that would justify the added complexity.

Caching and Good naming is actually what defines a Good Software Architect. Caching is a very very important topic. When you start working on a huge scale Application with over a 100 Server you really appreciate caching even if you cache for 1min. 

It can reduce your application cost and overload so Yes it's the new RAM.
